author: Farid Cooper
comment: I can't seem to get the Trex and velociraptor to use as background on both my LG G watch R and Sony SmartWatch 3

reply.author: Fat Russell
reply.content:
Hi Farid,
Sometimes the background picker can take a few tries - make sure the dinosaur is highlighted - hopefully this helps, thank you!

author: Jim Gurney
comment: Uninstalled, reinstalled, prompted on watch to install on watch, all great now. Excellent Developer, quick to respond

reply.author: Fat Russell
reply.content:
Hi Jim,
Awesome! Thanks for letting me know :)
Enjoy the Dinosaurs!

author: jesusisgood2me AJ
comment: Works great on my ZTE smartwatch, but would like digital option.

author: Dan Killam
comment: I'm a paleontologist teaching a class on dinosaurs. Will see if my students notice this! Looks great on my Huawei watch and the battery level and steps are a nice touch.

reply.author: Fat Russell
reply.content:
Hi Dan!
That's awesome! Let us know what they think :)

author: Aiddy Stibbs
comment: Great fun. Would like to be able to change the face on the phone rather than the watch. Would also like the Dino outlined in ambient mode. Still love though.

reply.author: Fat Russell
reply.content:
Hi Aiddy!
We actually had the initial ambient mode include the dinosaur, but felt it made the time too difficult to read. Also, we made the config activity on the watch so this was available to iPhone users - but I appreciate you leaving feedback and letting us know your thoughts! :)

author: Lowell Crook
comment: Super fun! It's a nice break from serious and ugly watch faces

author: Brad Barracuda
comment: Thank you Fat Russell for making my life emote complete

author: Huy Tran
comment: The thunderbolt icon seems to stick on screen even when not charging. It should show battery % when off charge and no thunderbolt.

reply.author: Fat Russell
reply.content:
Hi Huy,
We used that icon to show battery (rather than write the word) similar to the walking person icon to show steps - so that was intentional, but thank you fo the feedback!

author: Blair Chasteen
comment: Unfortunately my Sony smartwatch 3 does not recognize these.

reply.author: Fat Russell
reply.content:
Hi Blair,
Try uninstalling / reinstalling or re-syncing the apps. We were able to reproduce this issue with a Sony smartwatch 3, and re-syncing the apps solved the problem. Let me know!

author: Marlon Jones
comment: Amazing work by an amazing artist :)
